name: Scott Gottlieb, MD

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD

Vaccines are presumed to offer better protection than natural infection, but we'll still see decline. By next winter many over 65 will be a year out from vax

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: Characterizing flavors in combustible tobacco are a gateway to youth initiation on cigarettes. Congress banned all cigarette flavors except menthol. It's time to complete Congress' public health goals: ban menthol in cigarettes and flavored cigarillos.  https://t.co/cecSWkPf9W

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: Lots of open Covid vaccine appointments in New York City right now. h/t @davidalim

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: The "double mutation" refers to two specific changes: The E484Q mutation (glutamate is replaced by glutamine at the 484th spot of the spike protein) and the L452R mutation (leucine is replaced by arginine at the 452nd position).

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: As India's Covid epidemic worsens, so does prevalence of a "double mutation" variant, which has mutations E484Q (like E484K) and L452R (found in CA variant). Now classified as B.1.617 – it's gone from 24% of sequenced samples in February to 80% on April 1.  https://t.co/tgCYu540MT

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: As COVID vaccine supply begins to exceed demand, we’ll need to find new ways to make access easier for people who still want to get vaccinated, but have challenges reaching the current points of delivery; and do more to share information with consumers to better inform decisions

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: It looks like B.1526 is out-competing B.117. @CDCgov should be urgently focused on determining why B.1526 appears more fit than B.117. Does it spread more easily? Is it piercing prior immunity? Many weeks have gone by as these same important questions continue to be asked.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD

tweet: Dr. Cavazzoni is an exceptional leader with deep commitment to FDA's public health mission. During a detrimental government shutdown in 2019, she was the acting principal deputy commissioner of FDA, and was instrumental in helping me guide FDA through that very difficult period.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: @SaraEisen This is why the key remains controlling the infection. The vaccine will be much more effective in low prevalence environments then places where virus is fully epidemic. The vaccine is the tool to control spread but it’s not the final goal, the final goal is ending transmission.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: @SaraEisen Each case must be investigated but we need to consider the backdrop. Michigan is having a very dense epidemic with variants widespread. This is a small number of breakthrough infections out of almost 2 million people vaccinated. Exposure to the virus must be very high in Michigan

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: These are prudent, calibrated steps by Michigan. A significant portion of their spread is in children, driven by outbreaks that are probably related to school reopening. We need continue to get kids back in class safely, but the situation in Michigan requires they tap the breaks.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: It appears Elon is mastering biotech.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: We’ve prematurely pulled back from some mitigation like masks. We’re near a vaccine inflection point, but not quite there yet. We need another 2-3 weeks. Variants and surges probably delayed a return to more normalcy, but hasn’t foreclosed that opportunity. Better days are ahead.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: People sense that Covid risk is receding with vaccines, and they want to reclaim normalcy. We need to issue public health guidance in a way that recognizes peoples aspirations. While we need to remain cautious a little longer, the situation should sharply improve this spring 1/2

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: Mobility is rising as more people move around. The increased movement of people, increased prevalence of contagious variants, and reduced adherence to measures like masks; can explain a lot of the recent Covid surges. But we need to know if reinfection may also be contributing??  https://t.co/0tMPJMquFh

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: The rise in Covid cases nationally is being driven by a surge in cases among younger people, including (in some states) school aged children . Data on cases from Massachusetts (left) and hospitalizations nationally (right) reveals some of these trends.  https://t.co/UTJG4vuJWH

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: There’s no comparable effort underway in the U.S. We need to know if COVID reinfections are occurring here, and perhaps driving some of the increase in cases we’re seeing, and we urgently need a more coordinated, systematic effort to collect and report this information @CDCgov

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: CT Update from excellent team at Yale. B.1526 continues to increase in prevalence in the sequenced sample. There are now at least 8 lineages in CT with E484K mutation, which was found on about 20% of samples sequenced last week. Highest concentration of 1526 in Fairfield County.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: As I noted on FTN, by assembling a large repository of dangerous coronaviruses into a single lab in a densely populated city, and experimenting on animals, Chinese researchers greatly increased the risk of a lab leak. To improve our safety, we must recognize these dangers.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: We knew that faulty data and gaps were making our response to Covid more difficult, and less effective. We knew that longstanding institutional shortcomings were contributing to those failings. This article from The Atlantic is an early cut at that history  https://t.co/d7JgpLF5eb

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: Atlantic notes "The data set that we trust the most... is the hospitalization data overseen by" HHS. But when HHS took this over from CDC, it was portrayed as 'politicization' rather than effort to reform "models" CDC had used to "estimate" hospital admits  https://t.co/d7JgpLF5eb

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: Atlantic: "For months, the American government had no idea how many people were sick with COVID-19, how many were lying in hospitals, or how many had died. And the COVID Tracking Project... had become a de facto source of pandemic data for the U.S."  https://t.co/d7JgpLF5eb

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: Key to broadening access to vaccines, especially in harder to reach communities, is bringing these opportunities closer to where people live and receive their healthcare; and making it easier to get a vaccine without complicated scheduling, at times and places that are convenient

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: The variant B1526 is rising in NYC. It now represents about 40% of all sequenced cases with S-gene dropout. The B1526 with E484K mutation is about half of these cases, at about 20%. name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: Vaccine “hesitancy” isn't the biggest challenge but making it convenient to get vaccinated. For too many people it's too hard to sign up, show up. People who work all day or care for families. We need to set up 24/7 clinics with no appointment needed for hard to reach communities

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: When President Biden says 100 million shots in 100 days they mean total shots delivered. I believe we’ll actually get 100 million Americans vaccinated by early April. That’s 100 million people with at least one dose and many will have received two.

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: My @WSJ Op Ed: 'The Road to Reopening Won’t Be a Straight Line' -- 'As more people get vaccinated, the Covid threat will change. It won’t go away completely.' On how we can, and will reclaim our normal lives and things we value. with Mark McClellan  https://t.co/nXdTuNI8Zq

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: We'll cross 60% of those over age 65 vaccinated and 70% of those over 75. The overall vulnerability of the population to Covid is declining, giving more chance to re-engage in things we value. We need to look at vulnerability of population in measuring risk, not only prevalence  https://t.co/nLNVtUVm5d

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: In 2009 U.S. allies blocked shipment of flu vaccine into U.S. until their needs were met. We almost held up a GSK shipment to Britain. In a public health crisis, we have ample precedent where nations nationalize supply. We need to have domestic capacities.  https://t.co/NlDaxtWuLc

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD

name: Scott Gottlieb, MD
tweet: More than 40% of those over age 65 are vaccinated with at least one dose. We need to start considering that population is becoming less vulnerable to covid. Against that backdrop, we should judge mitigation and the risk of infection differently as the vulnerable become protected.
